snippet: Facing defeat at the hands of Conservative backbenchers, the coalition government of Prime Minister David Cameron abandoned efforts to fast-track a historic reform in the British Parliament.
abstract: Coalition government led by Prime Min David Cameron abandons efforts to fast-track a historic reform of the House of Lords, the appointed upper house of the British Parliament; decision is a concession to a rebel group of nearly 100 Conservative backbenchers who oppose the coalition’s plans.
lead_paragraph: Facing defeat at the hands of Conservative backbenchers, the coalition government of Prime Minister David Cameron abandoned efforts to fast-track a historic reform in the British Parliament.

headline.seo: Britain’s Coalition Government Retreats on Reform for House of Lords
headline.main: No Vote on Reform for House of Lords
headline.print_headline: No Vote On Reform For House Of Lords
